intro: Echinella tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly echinella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
